   .dojoDndItemOver  {	background: #ededed; }

   #tabs12 a { background:transparent url(http://www.muhlenberg.edu/library/img/libguides-tableft-blue.gif) no-repeat scroll left top; }

      </span>
     </h1>
    </div>
    <div class="guideattr" id="guideattr">
     <span id="lastupdate" class="lastupdate">
      Last Updated: Aug 24, 2016
     </span>
     <span class="guideurl">
      URL: http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/getstarted
     </span>
     <span class="printguideurl" style="padding:0px 10px 0px 10px;">

       <a href="/print_content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=3878122&amp;mode=g" title="View in a format suitable for printers and screen readers">
        Print Guide
       </a>
      </span>
     </span>

          </a>

        </span>
       </td>
       <td align="right" style="white-space:nowrap;">
        <span class="lgsearch">
        </span>
        <form method="post" name="homesearch" style="display:inline;">
         <!--labels to help with accessibility -->
         <label for="searchs" style="display:none;">
          Search Text
         </label>
         <label for="what" style="display:none;">
          Search Type
         </label>
         <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
          <tr>
           <td valign="middle">
            <div id="lgsearch_label" class="lgsearch_item">
             &nbsp;&nbsp;Search:&nbsp;
            </div>
           </td>
           <td valign="middle">
            <div id="lgsearch_field" class="lgsearch_item">
             <input type="text" class="searchField" name="searchs" id="searchs" onkeypress="return handleEnterSearch(event,'homesearch','customSearch()');" />
             &nbsp;
            </div>
           </td>
           <td valign="middle">
            <div id="lgsearch_dropdown" class="lgsearch_item">
             <select id="what" name="what" class="dropdownform" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;">
              <option value="/search.php?iid=3322&amp;c=0&amp;gid=0&amp;pid=471100&amp;search=">
               This Guide
              </option>
              <option value="/search.php?iid=3322&amp;gid=0&amp;c=0&amp;search=">
               All Guides
              </option>
             </select>
            </div>
           </td>
           <td valign="middle">
            <div id="lgsearch_button" class="lgsearch_item" style="padding-right:2px;">
             <button dojotype="dijit.form.Button" type="button" name="fb" onclick="customSearch();" style="font-size:10px;">
              Search
             </button>
            </div>
           </td>
          </tr>
         </table>
        </form>
       </td>

    <div id="commentslistp3878122" style="display:none; margin:0px 10px;">

    <div id="content">
     <div id="contentleft" style="width:230px;">
      <div id="leftboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox14024592">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="14024592">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title14024592">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Research Tips
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content14024592">
          <p>
           <strong>
            On this page:
           </strong>
          </p>
          <ul>
           <li>
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=3878122#14024680">
             Too Few Search Results?&nbsp; Try...
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=3878122#14024682">
             Too Many Search Results?&nbsp; Try...
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
          <div id="boxatt14024592" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:520px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox14024680">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="14024680">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title14024680">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Too Few Search Results?  Try...
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content14024680">
          <ul>
           <li>
            <strong>
             Breaking your topic down into its most important concepts.&nbsp;
            </strong>
           </li>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Instead of searching all the words in your research question (e.g.,
             <em>
              How does sleep deprivation affect college students' learning?
             </em>
             ), try using only the most important concepts (e.g., "
             <em>
              sleep deprivation"
             </em>
             and
             <em>
              "college students"
             </em>
             and
             <em>
              learning
             </em>
             ).
            </li>
           </ul>
           <li>
            <strong>
             Using broader search terms.
            </strong>
           </li>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Instead of searching very specifically phrased search terms (e.g.,
             <em>
              "sleep deprivation"
             </em>
             ), try searching more general or foundational terms (e.g.,
             <em>
              sleep
             </em>
             ).
            </li>
           </ul>
           <li>
            <strong>
             Adding synonyms for your search terms.
            </strong>
           </li>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Instead of searching only one word for your concept (e.g.,
             <em>
              learning
             </em>
             ), try searching multiple words that express the concept you are researching (e.g.,
             <em>
              learning
             </em>
             or
             <em>
              achievement&nbsp;
             </em>
             or
             <em>
              education
             </em>
             ).
            </li>
           </ul>
           <li>
            <strong>
             Using fewer search terms.&nbsp;
            </strong>
           </li>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Instead of searching every concept in your research question (e.g., "
             <em>
              sleep deprivation"
             </em>
             and
             <em>
              "college students"
             </em>
             and
             <em>
              learning
             </em>
             ), try removing some of the less important or more transferrable concepts (e.g., "
             <em>
              sleep deprivation"
             </em>
             and&nbsp;
             <em>
              learning
             </em>
             ).
            </li>
           </ul>
           <li>
            <strong>
             Adding variations of search terms.
            </strong>
           </li>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Instead of searching only one variation of a word (e.g.,
             <em>
              learning
             </em>
             <em>
             </em>
             ), try using truncation symbols to find variations of the words (e.g.,
             <em>
              learn*
             </em>
             will search for learn, learning, learned, etc.). (Note: most databases and catalogs recognize * as the truncation symbol, although a few use another character, such as !.)
             <strong>
              <br />
             </strong>
            </li>
           </ul>
           <li>
            <strong>
             Using a different search tool.
            </strong>
           </li>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Instead of searching only one database or catalog, try a variety of search tools.&nbsp;
             <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/welcome">
              Subject Guides
             </a>
             point you toward recommended resources in each subject area.
            </li>
           </ul>
          </ul>
          <div id="boxatt14024680" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox14024682">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="14024682">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title14024682">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Too Many Search Results?  Try...
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content14024682">
          <ul class="bullet">
           <li>
            <b>
             Narrowing your topic
            </b>
            .
           </li>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Instead of researching a very broad topic (e.g.,
             <em>
              role of the military in the Middle East
             </em>
             ), try narrowing to a more specific angle (e.g.,
             <em>
              role of the military in Syrian politics
             </em>
             ).&nbsp;
            </li>
           </ul>
           <li>
            <b>
             Leaving out synonyms
            </b>
            .
           </li>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Instead of searching multiple words for the concept you are researching (e.g.,
             <em>
              politics
             </em>
             or
             <em>
              "political parties"
             </em>
             or
             <em>
              government
             </em>
             ), try searching the most specific, accurate term (e.g.,
             <em>
              "political parties"
             </em>
             ).
            </li>
           </ul>
           <li>
            <b>
             Using subject headings or descriptors
            </b>
            .
           </li>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Instead of doing keyword searching, try searching with subject headings, also known as descriptors.&nbsp; Many databases and catalogs provide special terminology to more accurately and consistently describe topics.&nbsp; Using that terminology in the right way can find better results (e.g., a database may use the subject
             <em>
              "armed forces"
             </em>
             instead of
             <em>
              military
             </em>
             .)
            </li>
           </ul>
           <li>
            <strong>
             Filtering your search results.
            </strong>
           </li>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Instead of sifting through all the results your search turned up, try filtering your results by publication type (e.g., peer-reviewed journal articles), by date (e.g., only items published in the last 10 years), or by language (e.g., only items in English) to narrow to the most relevant information.
            </li>
           </ul>
          </ul>
          <div id="boxatt14024682" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentright" style="width:209px;float:left; padding-right:0px;">
      <div id="profile3878122" class="profile_wrapper">
      </div>
      <div id="rightboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox14024123">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="14024123">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title14024123">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Get Help
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content13943779">
          <p>
           Need more help with this?&nbsp;
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/research/ask-a-librarian.html">
            Ask a Librarian
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <br />
           Need help with writing?&nbsp; Contact the
           <a href="http://www.muhlenberg.edu/main/academics/writing/center/">
            Writing Center
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt13943779" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>

    </div>
    <img alt="Tip" style="top:-200px; left:-500px;" id="tippointer" src="http://lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/tippointer.gif" />
    <div id="popupinfo" class="popup" style="visibility: visible; top:-200px; left:-500px;">
     <div class="popup_head">
      <table align="right" border="0">
       <tr>
        <td valign="bottom" height="18">
         <a href="#" onclick="return hideAlert('popupinfo')">
          <img alt="Close" src="http://lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/window_close_grey.gif" border="0" align="absbottom" />
         </a>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <div id="popupinfotitle" style="display:inline;">
       <h6>
        More Information
       </h6>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="popup_body">
      <div id="popupinfocontent" style="display:inline;">
       <img alt="Loading" src="http://lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/indicator.gif" />
       &nbsp; Loading...
      </div>
      <br />
      <center>
       <a href="#" onclick="hideAlert('popupinfo'); return false;">
        Close
       </a>
      </center>
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
  <div id="dp" style="width:850px;">
   &nbsp;
  </div>
  <script type="text/javascript">
   cssdropdown.startchrome("tabs12");
  </script>
  <script type="text/javascript">
   SpringTrack.trackPage({ 
                        st_type : content_config.hitsource, 
                        _st_gid : content_config.gid 
                    });
  </script>
